sentences.english: You hurt my feelings by betraying me when I'm in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你太傷我感情了，居然在我身陷困境之時背叛了我。

sentences.english: It is a shortcut to accomplishment and an easy escape from embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 它是走向成功的捷徑，也是擺脫困境的妙方。

sentences.english: I'm sure we will twelve-step our way out of the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 我堅信我們會一步步擺脫困境的。

sentences.english: It’s no big deal. I don’t mind helping you out.
sentences.chinese: 這沒什麼大不了的，我不介意幫助你擺脫困境。

sentences.english: But for the second day in a row, banking stocks in particular faced a rough ride.
sentences.chinese: 不過，在歐洲股市上，金融股連續第二天遭遇困境。

sentences.english: In the 1990s, Harman Kardon was running into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 90年代，哈曼卡頓的經營陷入了困境。

sentences.english: Once my family knew the truth, they helped give me the strength to walk away from the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我孃家人瞭解真相後，給了我力量走出困境。

sentences.english: The ideas of how to help their company get out of dilemma occupied the proscenium of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他首先想的是怎樣幫助他們的公司走出困境。

sentences.english: They try to find a way out of their dilemma.
Two high-income economies got themselves into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 兩大高收入經濟體使自己陷入了困境。

sentences.english: Beauvoir appeals women to seek their fortune in difficulties in "the second sex".
sentences.chinese: 波伏娃在《第二性》中呼籲女性在困境中尋找出路。

sentences.english: By the end of last year, he had wiggled out of the mess.
sentences.chinese: 到去年年底，他已經從困境中擺脫出來。

sentences.english: But she brought the plight of the gorillas to everyone's attention.
sentences.chinese: 但是她讓每個人開始關注大猩猩的困境。

sentences.english: Climate-sensitive reds such as pinot noir are also in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 黑皮諾之類的氣候敏感型紅葡萄酒也會陷入困境。

sentences.english: Consequently, "post-art history" falls into a predicament of ineffective writing.
sentences.chinese: 因而，“後藝術史”陷入了無效寫作的困境。

sentences.english: It is also used to subsidize loan modifications for troubled homeowners. .
sentences.chinese: 它同樣用在了資助減輕陷入困境的房主的貸款上。

definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to face sth/to be confronted with
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
